cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
What number shirt did England rugby union player Jonny Wilkinson wear in the 2011 World Cup?
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process:
To determine the number shirt that Jonny Wilkinson wore during the 2011 Rugby World Cup, we need to consider his position and the typical numbering associated with that position in rugby union. Jonny Wilkinson is primarily known as a fly-half, which is usually assigned the number 10 jersey in rugby union. 

In the context of the 2011 Rugby World Cup, Jonny Wilkinson was part of the England national team, and he played in the fly-half position throughout the tournament. Therefore, it is reasonable to conclude that he wore the number 10 shirt.

Answer:
10

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
What number shirt did England rugby union player Jonny Wilkinson wear in the 2011 World Cup?
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['Jonathan Peter Wilkinson, CBE (born 25 May 1979) is an English former rugby union player. A fly-half, he played for Newcastle Falcons and Toulon and represented England and the British and Irish Lions. He is particularly known for scoring the winning drop goal in the 2003 Rugby World Cup Final and is widely acknowledged as one of the best rugby union players of all time.\n', 'BULLET::::- Jonny Wilkinson (born 1979) Rugby Union World Cup winner\n', 'BULLET::::- Jonny Wilkinson (born 1979), world cup winning rugby footballer\n', "BULLET::::- Rugby Football; in recent times, Jonny Wilkinson's (b. 1979) dropped goal in the final minute of the 2003 Rugby World Cup Final.\n", 'BULLET::::- May 25 – Jonny Wilkinson, English rugby union player\n', 'BULLET::::- 24 May – Jonny Wilkinson plays his final rugby match in Britain before retiring from the sport, helping Toulon to beat Saracens 23–6 and win the Heineken Cup.\n', 'BULLET::::- Jonny Wilkinson, England rugby international, and Newcastle Falcons player\n', 'BULLET::::- 25 May – Jonny Wilkinson, rugby union player\n', 'In August 2002, Wilkinson signed for the Newcastle Falcons, where his brother, Jonny, was captain. He made his professional debut against Leeds Carnegie, playing as centre, but unusually, for that position, wearing the 15 shirt. His performance drew praise from then-manager Rob Andrew, whom stated "It was a pretty big debut for someone who hasn\'t played higher than Third Division North before." He made his European Challenge Cup debut in a 27–8 defeat to Treviso, His first appearance at fly-half, would not prove successful, as Newcastle lost 20–0 against London Irish. At the end of the season, he had made six appearances in the league, and five in the European Challenge Cup. He would feature far less the following season, making just four league appearances, and two Challenge Cup appearances, although he did score his first professional tries against Valladolid RAC in a 71–10 victory for the Falcons. He made five Premiership appearances in the 2004/05 season, with his Heineken Cup debut coming against Newport Gwent Dragons, playing at fly half in a 25–17 victory. 2005/06 would see him make just one appearance, a brief appearance from the substitute\'s bench in a 27–18 defeat against Saracens.\n', 'BULLET::::- Jonny Wilkinson (born 1979), English rugby union player\n']

question_info.question: What number shirt did England rugby union player Jonny Wilkinson wear in the 2011 World Cup?
passages:
Jonathan Peter Wilkinson, CBE (born 25 May 1979) is an English former rugby union player. A fly-half, he played for Newcastle Falcons and Toulon and represented England and the British and Irish Lions. He is particularly known for scoring the winning drop goal in the 2003 Rugby World Cup Final and is widely acknowledged as one of the best rugby union players of all time.
BULLET::::- Jonny Wilkinson (born 1979) Rugby Union World Cup winner
BULLET::::- Jonny Wilkinson (born 1979), world cup winning rugby footballer
BULLET::::- Rugby Football; in recent times, Jonny Wilkinson's (b. 1979) dropped goal in the final minute of the 2003 Rugby World Cup Final.
BULLET::::- May 25 – Jonny Wilkinson, English rugby union player
BULLET::::- 24 May – Jonny Wilkinson plays his final rugby match in Britain before retiring from the sport, helping Toulon to beat Saracens 23–6 and win the Heineken Cup.
BULLET::::- Jonny Wilkinson, England rugby international, and Newcastle Falcons player
BULLET::::- 25 May – Jonny Wilkinson, rugby union player
In August 2002, Wilkinson signed for the Newcastle Falcons, where his brother, Jonny, was captain. He made his professional debut against Leeds Carnegie, playing as centre, but unusually, for that position, wearing the 15 shirt. His performance drew praise from then-manager Rob Andrew, whom stated "It was a pretty big debut for someone who hasn't played higher than Third Division North before." He made his European Challenge Cup debut in a 27–8 defeat to Treviso, His first appearance at fly-half, would not prove successful, as Newcastle lost 20–0 against London Irish. At the end of the season, he had made six appearances in the league, and five in the European Challenge Cup. He would feature far less the following season, making just four league appearances, and two Challenge Cup appearances, although he did score his first professional tries against Valladolid RAC in a 71–10 victory for the Falcons. He made five Premiership appearances in the 2004/05 season, with his Heineken Cup debut coming against Newport Gwent Dragons, playing at fly half in a 25–17 victory. 2005/06 would see him make just one appearance, a brief appearance from the substitute's bench in a 27–18 defeat against Saracens.
BULLET::::- Jonny Wilkinson (born 1979), English rugby union player
